newsitem.title: UK: LME aluminium, copper steady in late Ldn.
newsitem.headline: LME aluminium, copper steady in late Ldn.

text.p: London Metal Exchange (LME) copper and aluminium were little changed from the kerb in late inter-office activity after the rallies seen on Wednesday. Copper ended the kerb $16 higher from Tuesday at $1,976 and was bid at $1,973 by 1800 GMT when Comex closed. Aluminium also remained firm and was assessed just above $1,400 per tonne by that hour.
"I think there's potential for more short-covering in both copper and aluminium," said William Adams, analyst at broker Rudolf Wolff.
Traders say further LME stock draws are expected in aluminium while copper inventories have already slid by more than 100,000 tonnes since the end of August.
